title: New Liverpool vs Leicester bust-up footage emerges after Anfield clash
text:

New footage has emerged showing exactly what sparked the furious full-time bust-up between Ayoze Perez and Liverpool stars at Anfield.

The Leicester substitute clashed with Andy Robertson as numerous other players got involved moments after the final whistle after James Milner's late penalty saw Liverpool snatch a 2-1 win.

It was unclear at the time exactly what had caused the carnage, with Jurgen Klopp and Brendan Rodgers both addressing the incident after the game.

Although they played down the scenes, they revealed Robertson had pushed Perez as they celebrated.

Footage from a new angle has now shown that Robertson barely nudged his rival with his elbow before being shoved from behind in retaliation.

(Image: Twitter)

That sparked the Scot getting worked up in response, with Milner and Adam Lallana also involved in the scuffle.

Perez was eventually pulled away with Jordan Henderson looking to calm things down.

(Image: Twitter)

"Andy Robertson celebrated on final whistle and pushed [Perez], which he probably didn't expect, which he was annoyed at," explained Klopp.

Rodgers said: "I think that, according to the guys, Andy Robertson celebrated and pushed him, which he didn't expect and he was obviously annoyed by that.

(Image: Twitter)

"And that lead to a melee, but it was nothing."

Whilst Klopp played down the incident with Perez, he was furious with team-mate Hamza Choudhury for his tackle which forced Mohamed Salah to limp off late on.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Klopp slammed: “It's just a challenge which I really don’t understand. How he can do it because the ball is far away?

“The player is in a full sprint to bring him down without the ball around, for me there is only one card. It is dangerous as hell.

“I don’t want to cause the boy any problems. He's a super player but these kind of challenges… no. “From a football point of view, if you are quick, you need to make sure. I only need two eyes to see it can cause injury.”
description: Footage has shed new light on the full-time bust-up between Ayoze Perez and Andy Robertson at Anfield
